text: Coat the skillet with oil. Place it on medium-high heat. Add the chopped pancetta or bacon. Fry until crispy, then remove from the pan and reserve. Add chopped onion. Sauté one minute, then add salt, pepper, and the chopped garlic. Add the zucchini. You may need to add more salt at this point, just keep tasting, and adjust the seasoning to suit your preferences. Sauté 3-4 minutes, or until the zucchini starts to get tender. Add the tomatoes. This is optional, you can make the sauce with or without them. Either way, give the whole thing a good stirring. Sprinkle the flour over the sauce. This is the thickening agent that will make a sauce of good consistency. Stir well. Now add the cream. Stir it in well, then turn the heat down and allow the sauce to simmer. As the mixture boils, it will thicken. Once the sauce has thickened, stir in the pancetta. Then serve it with your favorite pasta. Garnish with parsley, and cheese if you like.  Finished.
